de.agilecoders.wicket.markup.html.bootstrap.navbar

Class AffixBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wicket.behavior.Behavior
      • de.agilecoders.wicket.markup.html.bootstrap.navbar.AffixBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.apache.wicket.IComponentAwareEventSink, org.apache.wicket.markup.html.IComponentAwareHeaderContributor, org.apache.wicket.util.io.IClusterable

    public class AffixBehavior
extends org.apache.wicket.behavior.Behavior
    To easily add affix behavior to any element, just add the AffixBehavior to the element you want to spy on. Then use offsets to define when to toggle the pinning of an element on and off. 

         add(new AffixBehavior("100")); // or
     add(new AffixBehavior("{x:100, y:50}")); // or
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    miha
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • offset

        public AffixBehavior offset(String offset)
        Pixels to offset from screen when calculating position of scroll. If a single number is provide, the offset will be applied in both top and left directions. To listen for a single direction, or multiple unique offsets, just provided an object offset: { x: 10 }. Use a function when you need to dynamically provide an offset (useful for some responsive designs).
        Parameters:
        offset - when to toggle the pinning of an element on and off
        Returns:
        this
